Even with Counter-Strike GO and Counter-Strike Nexon being released this game remains the staple of [strike]hardcore gaming encouraged to make you ragequit[/strike] online gaming at its finest. I've already lost count of the amount of times some guy headshotted me with an AK-47 while I was 40m away. In all seriousness though, the only way you could ever hope to get good at this game is to learn the maps, learn every weapon and get used to it, put in the hours and have a bit of reaction time on your side because when you're up against guys who have played for ten years you will seriously know what hardcore is. Best of luck.

But 8/10.
Bring back the feeling... wie in alten Zeiten. Wem CS:GO zu neu und 1.6 zu altbacken ist, findet sich hier gut wieder.

Counter-Strike: Source is a prerequisite to play Garry's Mod at optimal performance, which includes most textures that servers use. However, this game isn't that bad, it isn't as good as CS:GO, I will admit. But, it includes several maps with community-hosted servers which are customised by everybody and has a large variety of tactics involved along with different weapons. Competitive FPS players should enjoy this game, it has several gamemodes. This includes deathmatch, bunny hop and several other unique gamemodes.
I only played it for a few hours. So i might need to give it more time before i give my full review.
